table_description: Azure Load Balancer Backend Address Pool

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the resource that is unique within the set of backend address pools used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.

columns.name: load_balancer_name
columns.description: The friendly name that identifies the load balancer.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.description: The provisioning state of the backend address pool resource. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Failed'.

columns.name: etag
columns.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: outbound_rule_id
columns.description: A reference to an outbound rule that uses this backend address pool.

columns.name: backend_ip_configurations
columns.description: An array of references to IP addresses defined in network interfaces.

columns.name: gateway_load_balancer_tunnel_interface
columns.description: An array of gateway load balancer tunnel interfaces.

columns.name: load_balancing_rules
columns.description: An array of references to load balancing rules that use this backend address pool.

columns.name: outbound_rules
columns.description: An array of references to outbound rules that use this backend address pool.
